website_summaries.verdict: For smaller yards, this core aerator can be quickly put to use to remove and loosen compacted soil, but it can be quite a workout in most conditions.
pros: On a freshly watered lawn, aerator is simple to use, and soil plugs rise out of the top of the tubes easily
Solid weld and sturdy build should last several seasons
Designed to drive in with your foot, saving arms and shoulders
cons: Aerator tubes can clog with a softer soil, requiring effort to clean
Manual tool means slow progress and quite a workout, particularly in clay or rocky soil
Handle is too short for some users

customer_reviews.title: Garden Weasel manual core aerator
customer_reviews.text: It does the job for a manual core aerator. It is perfect for a small yard < 1000 sqft. It is an all metal tool. The welding seems to be pretty solid. I have used it for one or two seasons and it has held up quite well. No bends, chips, or cracks. The plugs sometimes get caught in one of the tubes and it can be a bear to get out. I wish the handle was "T" shaped so that it is easier to hold and use. However, I did like the metal ring on the end of the handle for easily hanging in my shed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Y.

customer_reviews.title: A+ designed well, made well and works
customer_reviews.text: I found this aerator to be well designed and made and its works well. The business end is designed correctly to aid the cores in slipping out the top. It will occasionally plug up depending on the consistency of the soil...soft wet ground will not have the power to push the core out, but will yield laterally to leave a hole. Carry an appropriate sized stick or rod to clear the tubes. My only gripe is that I wish the handle were a few inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M. Wyant

customer_reviews.title: Amazing alternative to paying for a machine
customer_reviews.text: I needed to aerate my front lawn. It’s not huge but a normal size suburban lawn. It took me about 45 min. You do need to push harder if you are a smaller person (my son is about 100 pounds and he couldn’t easily do it ). But for me it was easy. The plugs come straight up through as you go to the next push. No clogging if you keep pushing out the dirt. Lawn guy wanted $250 because he Needed to rent a heavy machine so I figured I would try this. It’s sturdy and well work the money. Put on music and go to town on your lawn :)
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: This aerator makes things very easy, with very sharp tines that penetrate the soil ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy a manual aerator, as I thought it would just be a lot of work. This aerator makes things very easy, with very sharp tines that penetrate the soil easily and extract perfect cores every time. Maybe some lawns will have much tougher soil to aerate, but this thing worked like a charm on my lawn here in South Carolina.
customer_reviews.author: PghAnimator

customer_reviews.title: Strong sturdy, takes little effort
customer_reviews.text: Much more robust than many I have seen. Like most garden tools they are not made for tall people, I accept that. Easily cores out wet soil, goes through small roots apparently, because my lawn is full of elm roots. T handle not required as rocking the tool slightly allows it to release, usually this motion is unneccessary. Solid welds very sturdy, I expect to outlast me like most of my other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Marke Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but not optimal design
customer_reviews.text: Well made and sturdy, but, after aerating for a couple of hours, the single pole was harder to use than a cross bar with two handles (as in other aerators), which is easier to grip, push/pull, and rest on. Also, the pole grip is made of a hard rubber, and my hands became sore and abraded after an extended time aerating (padded gloves recommended, which I didn't use). Lastly, the two cutting tines could have been sharper, as it did take some effort forcing them into the ground, though ground was a bit dry. I would like to see Garden Weasel make a version with a cross bar, which I would buy. I will likely return this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Clark

customer_reviews.title: Works - ok overall: great sometimes, poor at others
customer_reviews.text: Have used this over 2 years now and when it can work well when there are no issues. At times though 1 of the 2 prongs consistently gets clogged and requires cleaning. This seems to be a tool/manufacturing issue as the other side worked fine and switching the tool around (i.e. rotating it 180 degrees) made no difference, suggesting it was not modest differences in the soil. Get ready for a mix of 'this is great' and 'uh, another clog'.
customer_reviews.author: cdim617

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and doing a great job!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Works great, if your grass is super hard and it's difficult just water your grass a little while before using and it gets those plugs out, I see a difference in my lawn where I've been using it-always been a trouble spot there! I highly recommend this because it's made very well, I read many reviews before purchasing it and although the price is a little bit more for this it's absolutely worth it because it's a tough tool!
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.  Solid Construction
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Solid construction. Great for small areas. I have 3000 sq ft of yard and was able to aerate it all in about 2 hrs. I like how it allowed for me to use the top of my foot to pull it out of the ground. Clogged twice in the most compacted area of my lawn so I would say that this tool is to maintain a healthy lawn and not necessarily to eastablish one that has been completely neglected or severely compacted.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The tool sturdy and is easy enough to use
customer_reviews.text: Although I regularly aerate my lawn, I have small areas in my lawn which always become thatched over during dry spells. I am using this tool to aerate and top dress these areas and it is working very well. The tool sturdy and is easy enough to use. I have not had the problem of it becoming clogged as some reviews mention. Highly recommended for manual aeration when a full size machine isn't needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Angle

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Aerates lawn great. Just takes a while. Wear gloves to prevent hand blisters and wear shoes/boots with thick stiff soles. Works best when ground is moist. If you notice one or both sides are not pushing out a core of soil check the intake for a rock. Only recommendation for manufacturer is extend the handle about 6” longer.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Parker

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it would be easier to pay the price of this hand tool for one year's worth of core aeration, but I love the exercise and being able to concentrate on the areas that need more TLC. And don't have to depend on the lawn service that may or may not come out at the right time (not too wet, not too dry). I'll knock off burrs if it starts to clog up, like others have described; have not noticed yet but still in the first season of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: one of my worst buys!
customer_reviews.text: one of my worst buys!!! the two holes get stuffed with dirt; and good luck with reopening them. after few times of unplugging, I was not able to clear the holes at all anymore. if you buy this, make sure to mark down the last day allowed for the return!
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: not worth it to me...
customer_reviews.text: received today. so disappointed! after using it for 15 minutes, both cutting edges dulling. i weigh 220lbs and it took every ounce to get it to penetrate almost all the way down - even it moistened earth. had to empty plugs out after every plunge. will try to find something more heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I own a landscaping company. It is VERY difficult to pull out once in the ground because of a lack of handle.
customer_reviews.text: I own a landscaping company. Goes into the ground easily. Pulls out slightly larger plugs nicely however the handle is too short for an adult and is VERY difficult to pull out once in the ground because of a lack of handle.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wasson

customer_reviews.title: clogs way to easy
customer_reviews.text: I have clay soil which may be part of the issue. The first season it worked ok. One side would send out a plug but not the other. The next season it just clogged up every time. I would clear it out but it would clog right up. A lot of money for only 2 months of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect 'lawn turds' just like the big machines--it just takes much longer. Worked great on my hard-to-access back lawn. Nice, heavy-duty construction. You do need to be somewhat heavy to use this. Don't expect your 100 pound kid to be able to aerate the lawn. I was worried that this would clog often with stones and pebbles, but didn't really happen. They guy who mentioned in his review buying two and then walking around with them--awesome idea. (I only got one because I wasn't sure it would work.)
customer_reviews.author: Ajay Wasan

customer_reviews.title: Works but not how intended.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is my soil but after the first penetration this just acts as spike type aerator. It still punches good sized holes in the yard but doesn’t plug like it shows.
customer_reviews.author: Tanndog

customer_reviews.title: plugged up
customer_reviews.text: Simply stopped working properly after a few hundred nicely cut plugs. Somehow, one of the plug cutters kept getting stuffed up, while the other worked like a champ. I examined the stuffed-up one as best I could, and found nothing that unusual inside. I cleaned the problematic tube several times, only to be thwarted within a few attempts. Overall, the device is well constructed and the outward finish is attractive. There just seems to be some internal issue that prevented the ejection of plugs on one tube. Also, ideally the cutting tubes would be longer (deeper).
customer_reviews.author: ReallyNot

customer_reviews.title: but I do recommend putting a screwdriver in your back pocket to clear ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is simple to use, but I do recommend putting a screwdriver in your back pocket to clear out the plug holes when they get jammed up. If you water the lawn real good for 2 or 3 days before hand, you should have no problems really. It's a bit of work, as it took me about 2.5 hours to do my front and back yard. I think that was better than the $70 or so that the local companies charge to do the same thing. I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: elvbot

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work in my yard
customer_reviews.text: Clogged up within the first 10 times I put it into the ground. I carried a screwdriver with me to keep pushing out of the plugs. I didn't make it two runs up and down my yard before giving up and deciding to forgo aerating this year. Don't waste your money, just pay the extra to rent a machine aerator or have a professional do it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a small little workout.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Be sure to use when ground is saturated from a rain or sprinkler. If you run into problems of it not pushing plugs out just take your garden hose with high pressure nozzle to blow out the compacted dirt. After using this garden weasel and spreading Milorganite on my back yard. The yard is filling in nicely even with three dogs playing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me!
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job, with very little effort. The hollow tines are approximately 9" apart so I kept a 9" grid throughout. It took about 3hrs to complete a 30' x 60' lawn. I had a couple clogs due to tight soil or stones, but not a big issue. I sprayed the tool with silicone lubricant part way through and it seemed to improve performance. Also helps if the soil is moist. Was still quicker, and cheaper than driving to the hardware store to rent a 4hr minimum power aerator.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff E

customer_reviews.title: one side keeps getting clogged
customer_reviews.text: so I should have read and believed other reviews for this product before I bought this. one side keeps getting clogged ( even after fully clearing it ) while the other side works like a champ. still makes this thing unusable since I don't want to end up compacting soil on the side where it is getting clogged....seems like a waste of money !
customer_reviews.author: apurve bhargava

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Works well most of the time. My lawn has some areas of clay soil, which can get lodged in the tube, not allowing the plug to pass through. You have to take a screwdriver and dig the blockage out. Works best on wet, sandy soil. Great for aerating into corners and around sprinkler heads. Its slow going but gets the job done. Built very well, so far a tool that is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clogs up easily
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, as a "core" aerator (i.e. removed plugs of soil from the lawn) for about 5 minutes of use - but then it clogged up & the subsequent cores would NOT eject. Unclogging it is no easy chore since the soil in the tubes is very densely packed. From there on, it became a "spike" aerator, i.e. just made a hole in the lawn, compressing the surrounding soil; but did NOT remove the soil core.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my yard!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I aerated my backyard (roughly 1000 sq ft) and I did it in less than an hour. It helps to water well the day before.
customer_reviews.author: Reza

customer_reviews.title: This is more expensive than other $25 aerators however it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is more expensive than other $25 aerators however it got clogged as well. Not sure why this got 4.5 stars and cost $45.
customer_reviews.author: conan

customer_reviews.title: I recommend keeping your box if your going to try this ...
customer_reviews.text: One side of my aerator works. I contacted the company and they wanted me to ship it back to them. They even sent me a return label. I tried to send it back a couple of times but, I was unable to find a box that would fit the aerator because I had already thrown away the one that came with it. I recommend keeping your box if your going to try this product. It's possible that some of these do work. Mine did not and it was very annoying. Ended up renting a machine aerator for $30.
customer_reviews.author: Kati LeQuia

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's a great tool and does the job! I did water the ground once the night before, again in the early morning, and then did the work later in the morning. Plugged a couple times in areas I had missed with water but otherwise it really works great and doesn't take alot of strength or manpower to push in. I'm super happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: AGirlNamedTBone

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: The Garden Weasel Core Aerator worked perfectly for me, on moist clay soil. The cores cut-outs clearly showed how compacted the soil is. I hope the aeration will allow better absorption of lawn nutrients. As easy as it is to use the Garden Weasel, it does take time and effort to do almost 1000 square feet. If my lawn was any bigger, however, I would probably rent a motorized aerator.
customer_reviews.author: The Continental

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Gets clogged easily and I guess it still works but after the first day it stopped tossing the plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Satoko

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.text: Gets clogged with the first use and unclogging it is nearly impossible. I should've returned it right after I used it the first time but I forgot about it and now I'm stuck with this useless tool.
customer_reviews.author: John Panzera

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to core the lawn. Using it to slowly remove lumps from lawn. Core out the middle of a lump to let it slowly settle down. Hose off after use. No rust or breakage so far.
customer_reviews.author: vin

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Aerated my 1000’ grass area twice since I purchased this item. Third time the pipe cracked at the weld. Sent email and phoned/left message with the manufacturer - no response. Seller is of no help.
customer_reviews.author: Daily Rider

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how well this would work but first try was a breeze. I have compact soil in my Colorado yard so I waited for some spring rain and the tines went in easily and the plugs were pushed out automatically. I'm actually buying a 2nd one for my other foot (kind of like stilts) to get this done twice as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best used about a day after it rains
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Best used about a day after it rains. Good for small areas--easy to cover, say, 5 feet x 5 feet in about 15 minutes. My only complaint is it sometimes goes in easier than it comes out; a T-handle would make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JSB_DDS

customer_reviews.title: CLOGGING
customer_reviews.text: I started using this aerator today as soon as it arrived. Within 5 minutes, I was only getting plugs out of one side. Cleared it out with a screw driver several times and it just kept getting clogged. If it didn't clog, I'd give it 5 stars. Maybe I just got a bad one? Hopefully I can return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it seems to work pretty good for being a manual aerator. Don't expect to go really fast but it is effective. It will get plugged every now and then but not too often. Just carry a screwdriver with you!
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Does tend to clog. I find I can prevent ...
customer_reviews.text: Does tend to clog. I find I can prevent clogging if I consistently give it a strong, fast push into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Y.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small areas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to aerate the strip of grass between the road and the sidewalk in front of my house. Perfect use and leave “goose poop” just like the machined type.

customer_reviews.title: it works great, after a good rain when the ground is ...
customer_reviews.text: it works great, after a good rain when the ground is soft is the perfect time to use this tool. I get a good footing and the dirt is kicked out with the next push, not hard at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice manual arriator for small areas where you need to plant grass or get into corners
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Good Product so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It clogs up occasionally but I guess this happens with all Aerators. There is no design issue I can see that would make this clog any easier than another product.
customer_reviews.author: 3dturkey

customer_reviews.title: It's ok if ok is alright with you
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and another by another manufacturer. This one is very light but the handle should be longer as well as the aerator plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Loffredo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy design too
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to use than I'd imagined. Good sturdy design too.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Mintz

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality product, vendor did a good job with packaging and timely delivery, and it should suit my purpose nicely for many years. I highly recommend product and vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome D.

customer_reviews.title: Easier than others, works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Less stress on the palms of your hand as it is more like a shovel type handle. I own a different brand that has handles like a pogo stick and can be tough on your palms. This one however seems easiest because the shovel type handle.
customer_reviews.author: Norby

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! The core-cutters are tapered, narrow at the bottom and wider at the top, making Garden Weasel aerator less likely to clog than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gerginski

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The coring tubes plug-up almost immediately and are difficult to clear.
customer_reviews.author: gladwig

customer_reviews.title: Jammed up hopelessly
customer_reviews.text: Jammed up hopelessly after a few minutes use with our tough Hawaiian soil, which I found impossible to remove using garage tools.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Wright

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It clogs quite a bit, but when it doesn't it works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Webic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to push-make sure soil is wet!
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to put into soil & remove, just make sure soil is wet!
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Therese H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool!
customer_reviews.text: The Garden Weasel Core Aerator works great! I have hybrid Bermuda grass and the Garden Weasel is a solid sturdy tool and works like a charm. My home is new construction with impacted soil and this tool worked great. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JFP

customer_reviews.title: Works well, seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It makes pretty large cores. For me it worked just as advertised. You can't clean the cores out very easily, but you just do the next one and it pushes the last one out. I guess it always has soil in it then
customer_reviews.author: Shortstack

customer_reviews.title: what would make this better though? A T handle
customer_reviews.text: Does what its suppsoed to do, what would make this better though? A T handle. Its hard to push down with your foot without much hand leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Core like a pro
customer_reviews.text: This thing cores like there's no tomorrow! Core-a-pallooza!! Very easy to use, pulls up nice plugs of sod, very robustly built.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: It is really well built for the price and sturdy however.
customer_reviews.text: When the plugs are full of soil, a lot of the time it doesn't push out, making this essentially a spike aerator if you have more clayish or thick soil. It is really well built for the price and sturdy however.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Takes forever being so small but had no issues in my rocky soil.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: A good tool to add
customer_reviews.text: I wish the handle had a T but it's manageable. The build seems sturdy and was well worth the price. I've used it once so far and I had no issues with the forks wearing down.
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I fill each hole with sand and it`s ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great ! I fill each hole with sand and it`s already making a difference !
customer_reviews.author: pops

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Why pay someone to do the job when I can do it. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, and once you get in a rhythm it goes pretty quickly. I think I aerated my (800sf) front yard in 3 hours? Not bad!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ausmus

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use then i initially thought. I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Easier to use then i initially thought. I can aerate 400sq ft of lawn in a few hours! of course this is after the ground is soaked from all the rain.
customer_reviews.author: newfly

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality. Can't see myself using this for very large areas, however.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Does work well. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: The holes quickly became clogged with mud or dirt. It didn’t matter the soil. I spent more time cleaning out the hole unsuccessfully than aerating my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: HWC

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. It has held up so far and the holes rarely get stopped up. Just keep a screw driver handy in case they do, and youre back in action.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This worked quite well and is very sturdy. Initially we didn't wait long enough after we ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked quite well and is very sturdy. Initially we didn't wait long enough after we watered, so it became clogged almost immediately. Once we let the soil dry out it was very effective. I would definitely recommend this product for smaller yards.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Z

customer_reviews.title: Constantly getting plugged up!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Easy to use but it constantly gets plugged up. Should ship with an ‘unplugging’ tool. Once the dirt gets packed it, it is almost impossible to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Kemmerer

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: great tool, although I recommend clearing the punches after use.
customer_reviews.author: I buy too much stuff

customer_reviews.title: I was so excited to use this and after about ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this and after about 4 minutes it clogged up and not it only punches holes and doesn't aerate. How has this product stayed on the market this long when it doesn't work??
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Its great.
customer_reviews.text: I want to get a second to be double efficient with this. It works just like a machine would.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: The mud stick inside the home. Not easy to take out mud. Poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: sh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, and the ring on the top makes it easier to pull out. Well thought out product.
customer_reviews.author: Nadar

customer_reviews.title: but it works great! Really easy to use and no problems with ...
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to arrive, but it works great! Really easy to use and no problems with the dirt plugs getting pushed out the next time I push it into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Puffy bird

customer_reviews.title: Punches holes in the ground and is easy to use and seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Does its job well. Punches holes in the ground and is easy to use and seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Corey G. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Handy lawn tool
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well although a bit slow to aerate a larger lawn. Keep 'plugging' for a few minutes every day and you will cover a lot of ground. It does give a 'professional' quality plug core.
customer_reviews.author: Audio file

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Working great right out of the box! Very sturdy and easy to use. Look forward to many years of Use!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lanham

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but for some reason one side always ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but for some reason one side always gets clogged, always the same hole. And once it gets clogged its a B to get it to stay clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Van Winkle

customer_reviews.title: does the job... as long as you ...
customer_reviews.text: does the job... as long as you have more time than money. Otherwise, for a large yard, just rent the machine every couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy..
customer_reviews.text: Very happy .... just don't use while the ground is moist. You'll never get the cores out of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: I like the platform provided that I can step onto to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very capable garden tool! I had my 12 year old daughter aerate my entire front yard. She had no trouble using it. The soil cores are pushed out by the next insertion. I leave the soil cores on the lawn as mulch. It's greatly improved the drainage of my high clay soil, and my lawn is much more lush, and there is far less moss after aeration. I like the platform provided that I can step onto to push the aerator into the ground. The handle is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: small yard and loving it. sometimes the plugs don't push through but that's ok for me.
customer_reviews.author: PoBoy

customer_reviews.title: This tool worked like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This tool worked like a champ, even on very dry compacted soil. Tough. I weigh 240# and put my full weight on it. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Diane K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes aeration holes just like the machines, except you are the machine!
customer_reviews.author: T. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Takes some work to do a large yard but works well if you're patient enough. Plugs come off easily when soil is not wet.
customer_reviews.author: Raycee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tool is well built easy to use tool. Does a nice job of aerating my small lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, worked very well in helping to aerate my lawn
customer_reviews.author: Chijioke Ibeh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This manual Core Aerator is the best! Works so well in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Hong

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. It does get clogged from time to time, but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Works better than i expected. Pulls up some nice plugs. Even if it does not eject a plug every time, keep going. The soil builds up in the cylinder and will eventually eject. If it is too compact in one spot, just push it down as far as you can and move on. The soil will eventually loosen up with continued use. I use it to get the corners of the yard and narrow spaces where the pull behind lawnmower aerator cannot get. Also use it to aerate bare/thin spots more often to help stimulate the lawn to spread into those areas.
customer_reviews.author: AverageGuy

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I am 6'2" 205 lbs and used it very successfully on a tough contractor compacted sod lawn (new build) and it worked great. KP
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's actually easier to use than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tom

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and well constructed
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and well constructed. I wish the handle was longer. even though i am under 6 foot, holding the handle straight out while leaning into would be great. The hands have to go down some and puts wrist in a slightly strained' position. It did not hurt, just awkward. For the price, the quality and solidness are great. Holes are big too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but useless
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an aerator, and have clay type soil look elsewhere. This clogs immediately, and is good for only poking holes in the ground. Don't expect to get any cores.
customer_reviews.author: CougFanInTX

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works very well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, well made and worked really well for me. Others have mentioned the welds inside the core tubes as being a little rough which made the cores stick, but on mine the welds were very smooth. It worked really well. I used it to do some smaller areas on my lawn I couldn't get to with a larger aerator pulled behind my lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: T Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great At First
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this tool and was so excited when I first got it...but after about 2 uses, the holes got plugged with dirt and it was almost impossible to get the dirt out. I had to soak it and then take a screwdriver and poke the dirt up. So now the tool is poking holes but not allowing the dirt to flow out the top. Maybe I did something wrong and there were some directions I should have followed, or the dirt in Southern CA is just to hard for this tool to truly work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Debora A.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Cored easily through mostly dry California soil. Not quick, but with a little elbow grease and a couple hours, this tool could conquer an entire lawn. I use it on high traffic areas only.
customer_reviews.author: Walton

customer_reviews.title: Not a rating for the product itself since it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a rating for the product itself since it is built solidly, but do yourself a favor and don't try to manually aerate your lawn! It's very difficult, rent the gas powered version
customer_reviews.author: JLF

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job aerating the lawn for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job aerating the lawn for a cheap price. The only downfall, as others have stated, the holes get plugged up quickly in clay soil. Keep a screwdriver handy to clear it out often. Worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

product_meta.title: Garden Weasel Core Garden and Lawn Aerator – Grow Grass Evenly, Provides nutrients to lawn, – Features comfort grip handle and made from Carbon Steel, Red and Silver
product_meta.description: Do you have thin turf? Poor grass color? Compact soil? Bare patches that don’t respond to watering and fertilizers? Then you need Garden Weasel’s Core Aerator. Hard and compact soil keep essentials like water, air, and nutrients from reaching grass roots. This amazing product stimulates root growth while providing your lawn surface with helpful nutrients. This natural method is easy on the back and simple to use. Simply grip the handle, place your foot in the stirrup, and press down firmly on the footplate to penetrate grass and soil in affected areas. This loosens soil and effectively prunes grass roots. As you repeat the process, the compact soil plugs will automatically extract though the aerator. These will breakdown on the surface of your lawn, providing valuable nutrients. The Garden Weasel Core Aerator is made with carbon steel. It is weather and rust resistant and comes with a lifetime for years and years of active service.
feature_bullets: BRING NEW LIFE TO YOUR LAWN – Do you have thin turf? Poor grass color? Compact soil? Bare patches that don’t respond to watering and fertilizers? Then you need Garden Weasel’s Core Aerator.
How it works – compact soil keeps water, air, and nutrients from reaching grass roots. The core Aerator stimulates root growth while providing your lawn’s surface with helpful nutrients.
Easy to use – to use, firmly grip the handle and Place foot in the stirrup. Press down firmly on the footplate to penetrate grass and soil in affected areas and repeat as needed.
Automatic nutrients – as you repeat the process, The compact soil plugs will automatically extract though the aerator. These will breakdown on the surface of your lawn, providing valuable nutrients.
DURABLE STRONG-STEEL DESIGN – The Weasel Core Aerator is made with carbon steel. It is weather and rust resistant and comes with a lifetime for years of active service.
